bibl.note: This is a letter dated May 29, 1838 from Mrs. James King to her son Henry King. She warns her son to take care of himself, and to observe safety and duty as a young soldier.

div1.p: We received your letter on the 25 whitch were truly gratifying I do assure you; My son I cannot discribe my feelings on hearing and seeing those lines comin from you stating you had arrived at calhoon safte and in good health

Henry I do miss you William and (Junior) Albert very mutch your Brother seems to be at a great loss. I do often think of you young boys with feelings that you are not a ware of you are young and unexperienced you are amidst a great many snairs that are new to you. therefore my Dear son I do insist on your bairing in mind the advise I gave you the evening before you left me siting on my bedside, Henry My Dear son do think of this, you know not the feelings of your Mother: great many persons says they do not know how I could give my concent for you to go but you know that I did not object - the first time but you are young it is true leaving your duty my son and act the soldiers part; you now have to see and act for yourself; I do hope and trust the God of heven will in curage you youths and gave you health and strength and return you saft home a gaine Henry we have herd that one of your company were shot kiled accidently by one of the soldiers; Mr Loass we herd was kiled by Mr Waide what a dredful accident my Deare boys be careful with your guns
Henry your ant Sally Ganaway has been very sick with the pleuricy but is better at this time the rest of your relations and friends are generally well William I saw your Father Mother and the girles the other day they were all well I sent Henrys letter up for them to read they were very glad to here from you; Cousin John Thomas and his lady has been up to see us

Henry WIlliam and Albert this letter I desipher for you all Dear boys we are all very often talking a bout you all; Charly says tell Budy Henry he can shoot the Indians with his fly gun Henry your little sister sits alone and gnaws a piece of bread

Cousin Lizzy and cousin Mary cousin Martha Sarah are all here they send their best love to you cousin Sarah says she will to you soone. you must write to me let menou all a bout how you are a getting a long let me know what is thought you all will have to do or gal where you will have to goe; write me word how your clothing will hold out, I wish to know whether you three mess to geather or not write me word who messes with you; your Father Brothers and sisters joins me in love to you I must come to close
div1.closer: I remaine my son your affectionate Mother Martha King Post script that has been erased
